titleStmt.title: A new narrative of the popish plot shewing the cunning contrivance thereof, with a signal providence to this nation in the discovery of it and the plotters, to the confusion of the wicked papists, and to the great comfort of all good Protestants : to the tune of Packington's pound.
titleStmt.author: Gadbury, John, 1627-1704.

titleStmt.title: A new narrative of the popish plot shewing the cunning contrivance thereof, with a signal providence to this nation in the discovery of it and the plotters, to the confusion of the wicked papists, and to the great comfort of all good Protestants : to the tune of Packington's pound.
titleStmt.author: Gadbury, John, 1627-1704.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Gadbury by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
"Two poems, originally printed separately in broadside editions with same title: A true narrative of the horrid hellish popish-plot"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
